docs.title: add(a, b)
docs.text:
This function adds two numbers together

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default a float

First number

required b float

Second number

required

Returns:

Name Type Description float

Sum of a and b

Examples:

>>> add(1,2)
3.0
>>> add(1.5,2.5)
4.0
Source code in src/calculations.py 
def add(a,b):
'''This function adds two numbers together

    Args:
        a (float): First number
        b (float): Second number
    Returns:
        float: Sum of a and b

    Examples:
        >>> add(1,2)
        3.0
        >>> add(1.5,2.5)
        4.0
    '''
    return float(a+b)

docs.title: divide(a, b)
docs.text:
This function divides two numbers

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default a float

First number

required b float

Second number

required

Returns:

Name Type Description float

Quotient of a and b

Raises:

Type Description ZeroDivisionError

If b is zero

Examples:

>>> divide(1,2)
0.5
>>> divide(1.5,2.5)
0.6
Source code in src/calculations.py 
def divide(a,b):
'''This function divides two numbers

    Args:
        a (float): First number
        b (float): Second number
    Returns:
        float: Quotient of a and b
    Raises:
        ZeroDivisionError: If b is zero

    Examples:
        >>> divide(1,2)
        0.5
        >>> divide(1.5,2.5)
        0.6
    '''
    if b == 0:
        raise ZeroDivisionError("Cannot divide by zero")
    return float(a/b)

required b float

>>> multiply(1.5,2.5)

Source code in src/calculations.py 
def multiply(a,b):
'''This function multiplies two numbers

    Args:
        a (float): First number
        b (float): Second number
    Returns:
        float: Product of a and b

    Examples:
        >>> multiply(1,2)
        2.0
        >>> multiply(1.5,2.5)
        3.75
    '''
    return float(a*b)

This function subtracts two numbers together

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default a float

First number

required b float

Second number

required

Returns:

Name Type Description float

Difference of a and b

Examples:

>>> subtract(1,2)
-1.0
>>> subtract(1.5,2.5)
-1.0
Source code in src/calculations.py 
def subtract(a,b):
'''This function subtracts two numbers together

    Args:
        a (float): First number
        b (float): Second number
    Returns:
        float: Difference of a and b

    Examples:
        >>> subtract(1,2)
        -1.0
        >>> subtract(1.5,2.5)
        -1.0
    '''
    return float(a-b)
